article:
A 'decade' is a period of 10 years. The word is derived (via French) from the
Ancient Greek dekas which means ten. This etymology is sometime confused with
the Latin decas (ten) and dies (days), which is not correct. [http://www.la-
rousse.fr/dictionnaires/francais/dÃ©cade/21969/difficulte Larousse, etymology of
decade] The other words for spans of years come from Latin: lustrum (5
years), century (100 years), millennium (1000 years).
